unitName: Protecting the rights of minorities, marginalised and vulnerable people
description: This unit explores a range of controversial contemporary issues in relation to the rights of minority groups in order to enhance student's understanding of the way in which international law protects and promotes the human rights of vulnerable people. It will analyse the normative standards designed to ensure respect for the rights of religious, linguistic and sexual minorities as well as persons with disabilities. Students will critique the work on the UN in this field and consider whether  reforms are necessary to better protect the rights of these four minority groups.
